title: Austrians vote with far right in sight of historic win
content: Austrians participated in a general election where the far-right Freedom Party could potentially secure a historic win over the conservatives. Under Herbert Kickl's leadership, the party has surged in popularity due to voter concerns about migration and inflation. The ruling conservative People's Party, led by Chancellor Karl Nehammer, remains close in the polls.
summary: Austrians participated in a general election where the far-right Freedom Party could potentially secure a historic win over the conservatives. Under Herbert Kickl's leadership, the party has surged in popularity due to voter concerns about migration and inflation. The ruling conservative People's Party, led by Chancellor Karl Nehammer, remains close in the polls.

title: Climate change, harsh weather in France bring challenges to Chablis wine country
content: The Domaine Roland Lavantureux winery in Chablis experienced a difficult 2024 harvest due to extreme weather conditions like frost, hail, and heavy rain. These factors led to significant crop losses and a lower yield of Chardonnay grapes. Winemakers are now adopting new strategies to adapt to the changing climate and protect their vineyards.
summary: The Domaine Roland Lavantureux winery in Chablis experienced a difficult 2024 harvest due to extreme weather conditions like frost, hail, and heavy rain. These factors led to significant crop losses and a lower yield of Chardonnay grapes. Winemakers are now adopting new strategies to adapt to the changing climate and protect their vineyards.

title: More than 20 Hezbollah members killed alongside Nasrallah, says Israel: Top developments
content: The Israeli military confirmed that an airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah and over 20 other members. The attack targeted underground headquarters beneath civilian buildings. This has led to heightened tensions, with Iran calling for a UN Security Council meeting to discuss Israel's recent actions in Lebanon.
summary: The Israeli military confirmed that an airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah and over 20 other members. The attack targeted underground headquarters beneath civilian buildings. This has led to heightened tensions, with Iran calling for a UN Security Council meeting to discuss Israel's recent actions in Lebanon.

title: Why a mom of 2 is busy planning her own funeral
content: Erika Diarte-Carr, a 33-year-old mother from Utah, faces a terminal diagnosis of Stage 4 small cell lung carcinoma and Cushing Syndrome. With just three months left, she has raised over $840,000 through GoFundMe for her children's future. Erika plans to spend her remaining time creating lasting memories with her kids.
summary: Erika Diarte-Carr, a 33-year-old mother from Utah, faces a terminal diagnosis of Stage 4 small cell lung carcinoma and Cushing Syndrome. With just three months left, she has raised over $840,000 through GoFundMe for her children's future. Erika plans to spend her remaining time creating lasting memories with her kids.

title: Tip from mole triggered high-stakes op to eliminate Hezbollah chief: Report
content: Hezbollah chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike on his underground headquarters in Beirut, following intelligence from an Iranian mole. This operation represents a significant blow to Hezbollah amid heightened conflict with Israel, resulting in substantial casualties on both sides.
summary: Hezbollah chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike on his underground headquarters in Beirut, following intelligence from an Iranian mole. This operation represents a significant blow to Hezbollah amid heightened conflict with Israel, resulting in substantial casualties on both sides.

title: China calls on all parties, 'especially Israel', to deescalate tensions after Nasrallah's killing
content: China has urged Israel and other involved parties to take immediate steps to reduce tensions following the killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli bombing. The Chinese Foreign Ministry expressed deep concern over the escalating conflict and advised its citizens against traveling to Lebanon, condemning actions that exacerbate regional tensions.
summary: China has urged Israel and other involved parties to take immediate steps to reduce tensions following the killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli bombing. The Chinese Foreign Ministry expressed deep concern over the escalating conflict and advised its citizens against traveling to Lebanon, condemning actions that exacerbate regional tensions.

title: Russia claims to down over 100 Ukrainian drones amid widespread barrages; fires break out across regions
content: Russian officials stated that more than 100 Ukrainian drones were intercepted on Sunday, leading to wildfires and damage to buildings, with Volgograd facing the heaviest assault. Meanwhile, Russian airstrikes injured 13 civilians in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine. Both nations are experiencing substantial drone and aerial attacks.
summary: Russian officials stated that more than 100 Ukrainian drones were intercepted on Sunday, leading to wildfires and damage to buildings, with Volgograd facing the heaviest assault. Meanwhile, Russian airstrikes injured 13 civilians in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine. Both nations are experiencing substantial drone and aerial attacks.

title: Watch: Trump tosses popcorn at stadium crowd that chants 'USA' on his entry
content: Donald Trump attended the Alabama vs Georgia football game, greeted by cheering supporters and tossing popcorn boxes to them. He watched from a luxury box after delivering a campaign speech in Wisconsin where he criticized Vice President Kamala Harris over her handling of the migrant crisis, suggesting she should resign or be impeached.
summary: Donald Trump attended the Alabama vs Georgia football game, greeted by cheering supporters and tossing popcorn boxes to them. He watched from a luxury box after delivering a campaign speech in Wisconsin where he criticized Vice President Kamala Harris over her handling of the migrant crisis, suggesting she should resign or be impeached.

title: Outrage erupts over Nazi-era song sung at Austrian funeral
content: A Vienna funeral featuring a song with Nazi-era connections has ignited controversy as Austria heads into elections favoring the far-right. Three Freedom Party politicians were present, prompting widespread condemnation from other political parties. The Jewish Students' Union reported the incident to prosecutors, highlighting concerns over rising extremism.
summary: A Vienna funeral featuring a song with Nazi-era connections has ignited controversy as Austria heads into elections favoring the far-right. Three Freedom Party politicians were present, prompting widespread condemnation from other political parties. The Jewish Students' Union reported the incident to prosecutors, highlighting concerns over rising extremism.

title: 'You wake up and the life you know is just gone': Residents share challenges as Hurricane Helene claims 63 lives
content: Storm Helene has left a trail of devastation across the Southeastern United States, killing at least 64 people and causing widespread power outages. Rescuers are facing immense challenges in their search for survivors. The storm has caused significant damage to homes and infrastructure, with residents showing resilience in the face of adversity.
summary: Storm Helene has left a trail of devastation across the Southeastern United States, killing at least 64 people and causing widespread power outages. Rescuers are facing immense challenges in their search for survivors. The storm has caused significant damage to homes and infrastructure, with residents showing resilience in the face of adversity.

title: Who was Nabil Kaouk, top Hezbollah commandar killed by Israel
content: Israel has killed Nabil Kaouk, a senior Hezbollah commander, in an airstrike following the death of leader Hassan Nasrallah. Kaouk served as deputy head of Hezbollah’s Central Council and was involved in military operations since the 1980s. Israel has increased its attacks on Hezbollah targets recently, including communication systems and various locations across Lebanon.
summary: Israel has killed Nabil Kaouk, a senior Hezbollah commander, in an airstrike following the death of leader Hassan Nasrallah. Kaouk served as deputy head of Hezbollah’s Central Council and was involved in military operations since the 1980s. Israel has increased its attacks on Hezbollah targets recently, including communication systems and various locations across Lebanon.

title: Virginia jury awards $300 million to women alleging sexual abuse at children's hospital
content: A Richmond jury has awarded a total of $300 million to three women who alleged sexual abuse while patients at Cumberland Hospital for Children and Adolescents in Virginia. Each woman was granted $60 million in compensatory damages and $40 million in punitive damages. This case marks the first of many lawsuits against the hospital and Dr. Daniel Davidow.
summary: A Richmond jury has awarded a total of $300 million to three women who alleged sexual abuse while patients at Cumberland Hospital for Children and Adolescents in Virginia. Each woman was granted $60 million in compensatory damages and $40 million in punitive damages. This case marks the first of many lawsuits against the hospital and Dr. Daniel Davidow.

title: Drake Hogestyn, beloved 'Days of Our Lives' star, passes away at 70
content: Drake Hogestyn, best known for his role as John Black on Days of Our Lives, has passed away at age 70. Initially pursuing baseball, he switched to acting following an injury. His portrayal of John Black won him many fans. He succumbed to pancreatic cancer after a brave fight.
summary: Drake Hogestyn, best known for his role as John Black on Days of Our Lives, has passed away at age 70. Initially pursuing baseball, he switched to acting following an injury. His portrayal of John Black won him many fans. He succumbed to pancreatic cancer after a brave fight.

title: Pope Francis vows to support clergy sexual abuse victims during Belgium visit
content: Pope Francis visited Belgium and pledged support for victims of clergy sexual abuse, committing to offer assistance after meeting with survivors seeking compensation. His visit drew criticism from King Philippe and Prime Minister Alexander De Croo, who highlighted the Church's delayed response in addressing the abuses that have shaken the institution for years.
summary: Pope Francis visited Belgium and pledged support for victims of clergy sexual abuse, committing to offer assistance after meeting with survivors seeking compensation. His visit drew criticism from King Philippe and Prime Minister Alexander De Croo, who highlighted the Church's delayed response in addressing the abuses that have shaken the institution for years.

title: Italy's Monreale Cathedral's stunning mosaics regain golden lustre
Air Canada fined for breaching restricted Iraqi airspace
content: The US Department of Transportation fined Air Canada $250,000 for flying through restricted Iraqi airspace between October 2022 and January 2023. The violations happened under a codeshare agreement with United Airlines. Air Canada stopped codesharing on the Dubai to Toronto route as of January 13, 2023, after being notified of the breach.
summary: The US Department of Transportation fined Air Canada $250,000 for flying through restricted Iraqi airspace between October 2022 and January 2023. The violations happened under a codeshare agreement with United Airlines. Air Canada stopped codesharing on the Dubai to Toronto route as of January 13, 2023, after being notified of the breach.

title: Seven Pakistani labourers killed by gunmen in Balochistan's Panjgur
content: Seven labourers from Punjab were killed by unidentified gunmen in Balochistan's Panjgur town. One worker was injured. This incident follows a series of violent events in August involving separatist militants targeting various locations. No group has claimed responsibility for this latest attack. ​​The BLA demands the expulsion of Chinese interests from the region and seeks independence for Balochistan.
summary: Seven labourers from Punjab were killed by unidentified gunmen in Balochistan's Panjgur town. One worker was injured. This incident follows a series of violent events in August involving separatist militants targeting various locations. No group has claimed responsibility for this latest attack. ​​The BLA demands the expulsion of Chinese interests from the region and seeks independence for Balochistan.

title: Why will there be no Fruit Loops and Flamin' Hot Cheetos in California schools anymore?
content: California governor Gavin Newsom has enacted a law banning certain food dyes in public schools starting in 2028. Targeting dyes linked to hyperactivity and behavioral issues, the legislation received bipartisan support despite industry resistance. The aim is to offer healthier food choices for school children without harmful additives.
summary: California governor Gavin Newsom has enacted a law banning certain food dyes in public schools starting in 2028. Targeting dyes linked to hyperactivity and behavioral issues, the legislation received bipartisan support despite industry resistance. The aim is to offer healthier food choices for school children without harmful additives.

title: 'Loser': VP Harris' campaign runs TV ad mocking Trump for avoiding second debate
content: Vice President Kamala Harris has launched a new TV ad challenging former President Donald Trump to another debate. The advertisement criticizes Trump's hesitation to face Harris again after their initial debate in September. Despite claiming victory, Trump remains reluctant, while Harris underscores the need for voters to witness both candidates discussing crucial issues.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has launched a new TV ad challenging former President Donald Trump to another debate. The advertisement criticizes Trump's hesitation to face Harris again after their initial debate in September. Despite claiming victory, Trump remains reluctant, while Harris underscores the need for voters to witness both candidates discussing crucial issues.

title: Historic North Carolina village submerged under water after Hurricane Helen brings heavy rain
content: Severe flooding from Hurricane Helene has submerged Asheville's historic Biltmore Village in North Carolina. The area is experiencing significant damage, power outages, and road closures. Over 200 people have been rescued statewide. President Biden has approved emergency declarations for several states to aid in rescue and recovery operations.
summary: Severe flooding from Hurricane Helene has submerged Asheville's historic Biltmore Village in North Carolina. The area is experiencing significant damage, power outages, and road closures. Over 200 people have been rescued statewide. President Biden has approved emergency declarations for several states to aid in rescue and recovery operations.
